publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Vienna : Where in is storied, ye valorous atchieuements, famous triumphs, constant loue, greate miseries, & finall happines, of the well-deseruing, truly noble and most valiant kt, Sr Paris of Vienna, and ye most admired amiable princess, the faire Vienna
monogr.author: M. M. (Matthew Mainwaring)

div.l: SInce graver wits (so much) thy Booke commend,
Whose censures doe my judgement (farre) transcend:
Why should not I rest silent, and admire;
Knowing my skill answers not my desire?
The reason is, I (rather) will improve
My ignorance, then to conceale that love,
Which duty prompts to speake, which still dothlive,
To honour thee, since praise I cannot give
To equallize thy paines in study spent,
Showes the exactnesse of a sollid braine,
That makes so small a volume to containe,
Love, Ʋalour, Fortitude; what not that's rare?
But in thy (pregnant) Lines composed are?
Wisdome, Conceit, Art, Learning, Knowledge, Wit,
Doe grace thy worke to make it exquisite:
Time shall proclaime thy worth to future dayes,
And Fame perpetuate thy living praise.
